hanzi-su-wiki:
塵

Значения

Пыль, грязь

Мнемоника

Земля 土 под копытами оленей 鹿 превращается в пыль.

Варианты

尘

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The Han silk script seems to be from the " earth " from the three " deer " provinces (the lower part is omitted, only the head of the deer is left), and the Xiaozhuan from the " crude " from the " earth " in the "Shuowen" means deer running in the congregation, meaning that the dust is flying. The original meaning is dust. "Said Wen": "𪋻, the deer line up the soil. From the rough from the soil. 𡔚, the text." Afterwards, " 𪋻 " are all provinces from a " deer ".

" Dust " in the Han silk book refers to the mundane customs, "Mawangdui. Line 192 of "Lao Zi Yi Ben": "With its light, with its dust, file (frustrate) its with (sharp) to solve its variability, it is the stomach (that is) mysterious." The whole sentence refers to the condensed light, mixed with the mundane. Setbacks and sharpness to clear up troubles, this is the realm of mystery and harmony. "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Jia" Jian 27 " Dust " is written from " Yao ", " Xing " sound; "Mawangdui. Laozi Jiaben is written from " tu " and " Zhen ".

" Dust " in handed down literature is mostly used as the original meaning, referring to dust. "Zuo Zhuan. Sixteenth Year of Cheng Gong: "It's very noisy and dusty", that is, it is very noisy and dusty. In addition to the trace, Zuo Si's "Wei Du Fu": "The Dust of Liesheng." In addition, Buddhism calls the world " dust ", and Taoists call the first life "Yichen". The Five Dynasties Shen Fen's "Continued Immortal Biography": "Ding Yue said that Wei Ziwei said: "Lang Jun is separated by two dusts." Ziwei asked about the reason, and replied: "Confucianism is the world, the interpretation is the calamity, the Tao is the Dust." " Dust " can also refer to long-term, "Er Ya. Interpretation under "Explanation": "Liu, for a long time." Zhang Heng's "Si Xuan Fu": "It's hard to lose money even if it's allowed to be unsuccessful", which means that it's hard to lose money after a long oath.
humanum_short_description_en: Han silk script seems to start from the " earth " from the three " deer " provinces (the lower part is omitted, only the head of the deer is left), while the "Shu Wen" Xiaozhuan starts from the " thick " from the " earth ". The congregation deer runs, meaning that the dust is flying. The original meaning is dust.
humanum_full_description:
漢帛書似從「土」從三「鹿」省(省去下部，只剩鹿首)，《說文》小篆則從「麤」從「土」，會眾鹿奔跑，塵土飛揚之意。本義是塵土。《說文》：「𪋻，鹿行揚土也。從麤從土。𡔚，籒文。」其後「𪋻」皆省從一「鹿」。

　　漢帛書「塵」指塵俗，《馬王堆．老子乙本》第192行：「和其光，同其塵，銼(挫)其兌(銳)而解其紛，是胃(謂)玄同。」全句指含斂光芒，混同塵俗，挫折鋒芒而消解紛擾，這就是玄妙齊同的境界。《郭店簡．老子甲》簡27「塵」寫成從「幺」，「訢」聲；《馬王堆．老子甲本》則寫作從「土」，「軫」聲的字。

　　傳世文獻「塵」多用作本義，指塵土。《左傳．成公十六年》：「甚囂，且塵上矣」，即非常喧鬧，而且塵土飛揚。又引申指蹤跡，左思《魏都賦》：「列聖之遺塵。」另佛教稱人間為「塵」，道家稱一世為「一塵」。五代沈汾《續仙傳》：「丁約謂韋子威曰：『郎君得道尚隔兩塵。』子威問其故，答曰：『儒謂之世，釋謂之劫，道謂之塵。』」「塵」亦可指長久，《爾雅．釋詁下》：「麈，久也。」《文選．張衡〈思玄賦〉》：「允塵邈而難虧」，即指信誓久遠而難以虧損。
humanum_short_description: 漢帛書似從「土」從三「鹿」省(省去下部，只剩鹿首)，《說文》小篆則從「麤」從「土」，會眾鹿奔跑，塵土飛揚之意。本義是塵土。

漢帛書似從「 土 」從三「 鹿 」省(省去下部，只剩鹿首)，《說文》小篆則從「 麤 」從「 土 」，會眾鹿奔跑，塵土飛揚之意。本義是塵土。《說文》：「𪋻，鹿行揚土也。從麤從土。𡔚，籒文。」其後「 𪋻 」皆省從一「 鹿 」。 漢帛書「 塵 」指塵俗，《馬王堆．老子乙本》第192行：「和其光，同其塵，銼(挫)其兌(銳)而解其紛，是胃(謂)玄同。」全句指含斂光芒，混同塵俗，挫折鋒芒而消解紛擾，這就是玄妙齊同的境界。《郭店簡．老子甲》簡27「 塵 」寫成從「 幺 」，「 訢 」聲；《馬王堆．老子甲本》則寫作從「 土 」，「 軫 」聲的字。 傳世文獻「 塵 」多用作本義，指塵土。《左傳．成公十六年》：「甚囂，且塵上矣」，即非常喧鬧，而且塵土飛揚。又引申指蹤跡，左思《魏都賦》：「列聖之遺塵。」另佛教稱人間為「 塵 」，道家稱一世為「一塵」。五代沈汾《續仙傳》：「丁約謂韋子威曰：『郎君得道尚隔兩塵。』子威問其故，答曰：『儒謂之世，釋謂之劫，道謂之塵。』」「 塵 」亦可指長久，《爾雅．釋詁下》：「麈，久也。」《文選．張衡〈思玄賦〉》：「允塵邈而難虧」，即指信誓久遠而難以虧損。
Elaboration: The Han silk script seems to be from the " earth" from the three " deer" provinces (the lower part is omitted, only the head of the deer is left), and the Xiaozhuan from the " crude" from the " earth" in the "Shuowen" means deer running in the congregation, meaning that the dust is flying. The original meaning is dust. "Said Wen": "𪋻, the deer line up the soil. From the rough from the soil. 𡔚, the text." Afterwards, " 𪋻" are all provinces from a " deer". " Dust" in the Han silk book refers to the mundane customs, "Mawangdui. Line 192 of "Lao Zi Yi Ben": "With its light, with its dust, file (frustrate) its with (sharp) to solve its variability, it is the stomach (that is) mysterious." The whole sentence refers to the condensed light, mixed with the mundane. Setbacks and sharpness to clear up troubles, this is the realm of mystery and harmony. "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Jia" Jian 27 " Dust" is written from " Yao", " Xing" sound; "Mawangdui. Laozi Jiaben is written from " tu" and " Zhen". " Dust" in handed down literature is mostly used as the original meaning, referring to dust. "Zuo Zhuan. Sixteenth Year of Cheng Gong: "It's very noisy and dusty", that is, it is very noisy and dusty. In addition to the trace, Zuo Si's "Wei Du Fu": "The Dust of Liesheng." In addition, Buddhism calls the world " dust", and Taoists call the first life "Yichen". The Five Dynasties Shen Fen's "Continued Immortal Biography": "Ding Yue said that Wei Ziwei said: "Lang Jun is separated by two dusts." Ziwei asked about the reason, and replied: "Confucianism is the world, the interpretation is the calamity, the Tao is the Dust." " Dust" can also refer to long-term, "Er Ya. Liushutong characters (10)

塵字的基本解释

塵
chén
见“尘”。

塵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chén］
［《廣韻》直珍切，平真，澄。］
“尘1”的繁体字。
(1)飞扬的灰土。
(2)污染。
(3)多用作自谦之词。
(4)踪迹。
(5)世俗。宗教称俗世，隐者称仕途皆曰尘。如佛教称人间为尘，道家称一世为“一塵”。
(6)久。
(7)比喻战事；祸乱。
(8)极小的计量单位。
(9)承尘的简称。即天花板。
(10)姓。明代单县有尘铎。见《单县志》。

塵字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　塵； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页236第38
〔古文〕??尘【唐韻】直珍切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】池鄰切，?音?。埃也。【爾雅·釋詁】久也。謂塵垢稽久也。【詩·小雅】無將大車，祗自塵兮。【後漢·班固傳】風伯淸塵。【拾遺記】石虎起樓四十丈，異香爲屑，風起則揚之，名芳塵。【嶺南表異錄】犀角爲簪梳，塵不著髮，名辟塵犀。　又淫視爲遊塵，見【穀梁序疏】。　又明窻塵，丹砂，藥名。【李白·草創大還詩】髣髴明窻塵。　又【梵書·圓覺經】根塵虛妄。【註】根塵，六根之塵，謂眼、耳、鼻、舌、心、意。又【列仙傳】麻姑謂王方平曰：見東海三變爲桑田，今將行復揚塵乎。　又姓，見【統譜】。　又叶直連切，音廛。【班彪·北征賦】忽進路以息節兮，飮予馬兮洹泉。朝露漸予冠蓋兮，衣晻藹而蒙塵。

塵字的源字形

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
塵字的起名意思

暂无。

dust
Basic explanation of words
dust
chén
See "Dust".
dust
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chén］
["Guangyun" Zhizheng cut, plain and clear. ]
Traditional characters for "尘1".
(1) Flying dust.
(2) Pollution.
(3) It is mostly used as a word of self-effacement.
(4) Trace.
(5) Secular. Religion is called the secular world, and the hermit is called the official career. For example, Buddhism calls the world dust, Taoists call the first life "yichen".
(6) Long.
(7) A metaphor for war; disaster.
(8) Very small unit of measurement.
(9) The abbreviation for Chengchen. That is the ceiling.
(10) Last name. There was dust duo in Shanxian County in Ming Dynasty. See "Single County Chronicles".
dust
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Ugly Collection] [The Ministry of Soil Characters] 　chen; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: page 236 to 38
[Ancient text]?? Dust [Tang Yun] Zhi Zhen cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] Chin and cut, "Yin". Aye also. 【Erya·Shigu】For a long time. That the dirt has been long. [Poetry·Xiaoya] There is no general cart, and I am in the dust. [The Legend of Later Han·Bangu] Feng Bochen. [Supplementary Notes] Shihu rises forty feet from the building, the smell is like crumbs, and the wind rises, he is called Fangchen. [Lingnan Table Different Records] The rhino horn is a hairpin comb.　 See also [Gu Liang Xushu].　 Minglong Chen, Dansha, the name of the medicine. 【Li Bai·Cao Chuang Da Huan Poetry】It looks like a bright dust.　[Sanskrit Book·Yuanjue Sutra] The roots are vain. [Note] The root dust, the six roots of dust, are eyes, ears, nose, tongue, heart, and mind. Also [Legend of the Immortals] Magu said that Wang Fangping said: Seeing Donghai San turned into Sangtian, the dust will be restored today.　Another surname, see [Tongpu].　The leaves are cut straight, and the sound is choppy. [Ban Biao·Bei Zheng Fu] Suddenly enter the road to breathe the festival, and give it to Ma Xihuanquan. The morning dew gradually covered her, her clothes secretly and dusty.
